rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TV.VISITNUM

datasetVariables.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Number
datasetVariables.name: VISITNUM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TV.VISIT

datasetVariables.description: Description of clinical encounter. This is often defined in the protocol. Used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY as a text description of the clinical encounter.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Name
datasetVariables.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TV.VISITDY

datasetVariables.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Due to its sequential nature, used for sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
datasetVariables.name: VISITDY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TV.ARMCD

datasetVariables.description: 1. ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a 7-period crossover were constructed using 2-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20. \n 2. If the timing of visits for a trial does not depend on which arm a subject is in, then ARMCD should be null.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Arm Code
datasetVariables.name: ARMCD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TV.ARM

datasetVariables.description: 1. Name given to an arm or treatment group. \n 2. If the timing of visits for a trial does not depend on which arm a subject is in, then Arm should be left blank.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Planned Arm
datasetVariables.name: ARM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TV.TVSTRL

datasetVariables.description: Rule describing when the visit starts, in relation to the sequence of elements.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Start Rule
datasetVariables.name: TVSTRL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TV.TVENRL

datasetVariables.description: Rule describing when the visit ends, in relation to the sequence of elements.
datasetVariables.label: Visit End Rule
datasetVariables.name: TVENRL

description: A trial design domain that contains the planned order and number of visits in the study within each arm.
label: Trial Visits
name: TV
